description: Two-grooved Milkvetch (Astragalus bisulcatus) is an amazing species because of its versatility in different conditions. Not only can it grow in dry, sandy conditions in full sun, it has also been found in shady areas with more moist soil. The plant displays two-grooved pods which range from 5 to 15mm in length. It has small, mottled leaves and yellowish-white oval flowers. Additionally, it is an important source of food for many different kinds of wildlife, from insects to animals. It is an amazing species given its unique appearance and ability to thrive in varying conditions.
